dn3:2.22.1_0: Then Pokkharasāti saw, attained, understood, and fathomed the Dhamma. He went beyond doubt, got rid of indecision, and became self-assured and independent of others regarding the Teacher’s instructions. He said to the Buddha,

dn3:2.22.6_0: Just as Master Gotama visits other devoted families in Ukkaṭṭhā, may he visit mine.
dn3:2.22.7_0: The brahmin boys and girls there will bow to you, rise in your presence, give you a seat and water, and gain confidence in their hearts. That will be for their lasting welfare and happiness.”
